intro: Macrocnemum dissimiliflorum, commonly known as the variable-flowered macrocnemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with distinctive sepals and petals that are usually pink or red in color. It is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
